description.en: Software Engineering history; software lifecycle, processes, quality; formal and informal communication mechanisms supporting process; participation in software engineering project
description.et: Tarkvaratehnika ajalugu, tarkvara elutsükli mudelid, tarkvaraprotsess, tarkvara kvaliteet. Käsitletakse nii formaalseid kui ka mitteformaalseid kommunikatsioonimehhanisme tarkvara arendusprotsessis. Osaletakse meeskonnana vastavas arendusprotsessis.

objectives.et: Kursus annab ülevaate tarkvaratehnika põhikomponentidest tarkvaraarenduse elutsükli kaudu. Kujundada teadmisi tarkvaraarenduse meetoditest ja arenduseks kasutatavatest tehnilistest vahenditest. Anda ülevaade tarkvara elutsüklist ja selle etappidest, mudelitest ja metoodikast. Tarkvaraarenduseks kasutatava tarkvara võimalused. Rollid ja vastutus.

learning_outcomes.en:
This course provides overview of software engineering basic components through Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). 
The course starts from History and Software Engineering sub disciplines, covers Software Development Methodologies and dive into every stage of Software Development Life Cycle from requirement gathering and analysis to deployment and maintenance. 
In this course also will be learnt some practical CASE tools on every stage of SDLC. 
Main goal of this course is to give good knowledge of software engineering process and tools through practical activities.

description.et: practical assignments gives 50% of total points
Final exam gives 50% of total points (Final exam is mandatory to pass the course)
You can also get additional points by performing actively in class.
Admission for the final exam requires achieve at least 50% in every assignments.
Only two grades are available: PASS or NOT PASSED
SDLC stage 2: Design. Aspects of software design, software design description (SDD), Architectural patterns MVC and Active Record, design patterns, Object-oriented design, software frameworks.

Introduction: About course (goals, structure, grading policy, completion requirements). What is Software Engineering? (Nature of Software, Software Crisis, Importance of Software, Software Process, Software qualities and Principles.)

Software Development Life cycle and it models. SDLC stages (Requirement gathering and analysis, Design, Implementation, Testing, Deployment and maintenance). SDLC models and methodologies (Waterfall, Incremental, Prototyping, Spiral, Agile models).
SDLC stage 1 (Part1): Requirements and Analysis. Types of Requirement, software requirements specification (SRS), Gathering and describe requirements. Requirements Modeling with UML.
SDLC stage 1 (Part2): Requirements and Analysis. Types of Requirement, software requirements specification (SRS), Gathering and describe requirements. Requirements Modeling with UML.

SDLC stage 3: Implementation. CASE tools on implementation phase, source code documentation, configuration management, stages of development, roles, collaboration and project management. Agile software development: overview of Scrum, XP and Lean software development.

SDLC stage 4: Testing. Goals of software testing, Software verification, software validation, Types of Software testing: Unit testing, Integration testing, System testing, Regression testing, Performance testing, Usability testing, Acceptance testing.

SDLC stage 5: Deployment and maintenance. Deployment and maintenance. Deployment activities and their sequence. Documentation related to software. Maintenance, Further development, Bug and issue tracking.
